dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, is boxing dead or what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, is boxing dead or what?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, uh, no, not at all, actually. It's, um, it's pretty electric right now, thanks to this new Canelo Alvarez deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, uh, no, not at all, actually. It's, um, it's pretty electric right now, thanks to this new Canelo Alvarez deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Canelo? Wait, I thought HBO, like, totally pulled out of boxing. What even happened there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Canelo? Wait, I thought H B O, like, totally pulled out of boxing. What even happened there?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But HBO announced last month that it would end its coverage of boxing at the end of 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they did, you know? After over forty years, HBO, um, announced they were ending their coverage. That, uh, that really opened the door.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they did, you know? After over forty years, H B O, um, announced they were ending their coverage. That, uh, that really opened the door.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The premium cable network had set the standard for televising the sport for more than four decades, and its pay-per-view arm featured many of boxing's biggest stars...But HBO announced last month that it would end its coverage of boxing at the end of 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, Showtime got him then? Or, uh, ESPN?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, Showtime got him then? Or, uh, E S P N?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Nah, neither of those, actually. It's this, uh, new streaming service, DAZN. They, like, came in with this absolutely massive offer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nah, neither of those, actually. It's this, uh, new streaming service, D A Z N. They, like, came in with this absolutely massive offer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alvarez will kick off his DAZN deal December 15 at Madison Square Garden against Rocky Fielding...The boxing world has been buzzing over Canelos next landing spot, with Showtime, ESPN and Turner all having been viewed as contenders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Massive? How massive? I heard something crazy, like, hundreds of millions. Is that even real?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Massive? How massive? I heard something crazy, like, hundreds of millions. Is that even real?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it's real. We're talking a minimum of, uh, three hundred sixty-five million dollars. That's, like, thirty-three million per fight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it's real. We're talking a minimum of, uh, three hundred sixty-five million dollars. That's, like, thirty-three million per fight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million, an average of $33 million per fight, according to his promoter Golden Boy Promotions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Per fight? Seriously? So, like, he's totally topping Floyd Mayweather now? I thought Floyd held that record.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Per fight? Seriously? So, like, he's totally topping Floyd Mayweather now? I thought Floyd held that record.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's comparable. Floyd's Showtime deal was, um, around two hundred million originally. But he, like, promoted himself too, so he earned more. Canelo's deal, though, it's, uh, right up there, maybe even more depending on fights.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's comparable. Floyd's Showtime deal was, um, around two hundred million originally. But he, like, promoted himself too, so he earned more. Canelo's deal, though, it's, uh, right up there, maybe even more depending on fights.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only comparable deal in boxing history was the six-fight pactMayweather signed with Showtime in 2013. It guaranteed around $200 million, on par with Alvarez's per-fight average. Mayweather eventually earned $450 million over the two-and-a-half year agreement, thanks to his dual role as boxer and promoter...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So is he, uh, like, the highest-paid athlete now? Globally? What about Messi or, um, LeBron?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So is he, uh, like, the highest-paid athlete now? Globally? What about Messi or, um, LeBron?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Potentially, yeah. Forbes is saying he has a strong chance. Messi was, like, second last year at one hundred eleven million. Canelo's already banked, um, over a hundred twenty million this past year alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Potentially, yeah. Forbes is saying he has a strong chance. Messi was, like, second last year at one hundred eleven million. Canelo's already banked, um, over a hundred twenty million this past year alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Mexican boxer has a strong chance to rank as the worlds highest-paid athlete next year in Forbes annual look at the top stars in sports. ... Messi will likely be Alvarezs biggest competition for the title of worlds highest-paid athlete. He ranked second on this year's list at $111 million...Alvarez should bank at least $120 million over the 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Just this past year? But, uh, he has to keep winning, right? And, like, fight GGG again?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just this past year? But, uh, he has to keep winning, right? And, like, fight G G G again?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He's got, uh, Rocky Fielding next month, then a title defense in March. And if he, uh, if he fights GGG again in May, which is, um, very likely, his earnings will just absolutely skyrocket.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He's got, uh, Rocky Fielding next month, then a title defense in March. And if he, uh, if he fights G G G again in May, which is, um, very likely, his earnings will just absolutely skyrocket.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alvarez will kick off his DAZN deal December 15 at Madison Square Garden against Rocky Fielding, and then likely fight again in early May for a Cinco de Mayo match.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, boxing isn't dead. It's just, like, moved platforms and, um, got way richer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, boxing isn't dead. It's just, like, moved platforms and, um, got way richer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much, yeah. It's, um, a whole new era for the sport with DAZN really stepping up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much, yeah. It's, um, a whole new era for the sport with D A Z N really stepping up.
